text: This is a list of rivers in Belarus. ==Longest rivers== {| class=wikitable !Name||Total, km||In Belarus, km |- |Dnieper River |align="right"|2145 |align="right"|690 |- |Western Dvina |align="right"|1020 |align="right"|328 |- |Neman River |align="right"|937 |align="right"|459 |- |Bug River |align="right"|831 |align="right"|169 |- |Pripyat River |align="right"|761 |align="right"|495 |- |Sozh River |align="right"|648 |align="right"|493 |- |Berezina River |align="right"|613 |align="right"|613 |- |Vilija |align="right"|510 |align="right"|276 |- |Ptsich |align="right"|421 |align="right"|421 |- |Shchara |align="right"|325 |align="right"|325 |- |Svislach |align="right"|297 |align="right"|297 |} ==List of Rivers in Belarus== Pripyat River *Dnieper River **Drut River (R) **Sozh River (L) ***Iput River ***Pronya ***Besed **Berezina River (R) ***Svislach ****Niamiha River ***Babrujka River **Pripyat River (R) ***Braginka ***Horyn River ***Styr River ***Ubarts ***Ptsich ***Sluch ***Yaselda River ***Stviha *Neman River **Western Berezina ***Disna ***Drisa ***Usa River **Shchara **Kotra River **Vilija ***Vilnia River ***Narač River **Merkys River ***Ūla River *Western Dvina **Pałata **Kasplya River **Dysna *Bug River **Mukhavets River ***Dachlovka ***Zhabinka ***Trascianica ***Asipaǔka ***Ryta **Lesnaya **Pulva ===Minor=== *Drahabuž River *Lovat River *Narew == References == * Belarus Rivers
